from plotly.offline import iplot
import plotly.graph_objs as go

daily_new_cases = go.Scatter(x=df1.index, y=df1['daily_new_cases'], yaxis='y1', name='Daily Confirmed Cases')
daily_vaccinations = go.Scatter(x=df2.index, y=df2['daily_vaccinations'], yaxis='y2', name='Daily Vaccinations')

layout_obj = go.Layout(title='COVID vs. Vaccines', xaxis=dict(title='Date'), yaxis=dict(title='Daily cases'), yaxis2=dict(title='Vaccinations', side='right',overlaying='y'))
fig = go.Figure(data=[daily_new_cases,daily_vaccinations], layout=layout_obj)
iplot(fig)
fig.write_html ('outcome.html')

## Inspection and Discussion of COVID 19 cases and Vaccinations


The time series colored plots have been drawn for Daily COVID-19 cases and Daily vaccinations at New Zealand. From the figure, we can observe that initially in March, 2020 and April, 2020 - the cases were high in New Zealand. However, later due to border restriction and proper measure help the country to curb further Covid 19 Peaks. Also, The vaccination here started from February, 2021 and now it is at its peak for vaccination at the country. Vaccination per 100 in New Zealand is 3.96 

The global ranking of New Zealand in terms of the total number of cases from the least side is 41. 
The global ranking of New Zealand in terms of  total vaccinations per hundred is 75 from the least side.
